drug.name: Oleandomycin
drug.description: Oleandomycin is a macrolide antibiotic, though it is less effective than erythromycin. It is synthesized from strains of _Streptomyces antibioticus_.

article.citation: Authors unspecified: Oleandomycin. Can Med Assoc J. 1957 Mar 15;76(6):493.
Authors unspecified: OLEANDOMYCIN phosphate. J Am Med Assoc. 1958 Oct 25;168(8):1011-2.
DIMMLING T: [Oleandomycin-triacetate, a new oleandomycin derivative]. Arzneimittelforschung. 1959 Apr;9(4):236-41.
KUNZER W, BECK B: [Oleandomycin & blood coagulation]. Munch Med Wochenschr. 1958 Sep 12;100(37):1391-2.
SULI M: [SENSITIVITY TO OLEANDOMYCIN]. Alergia. 1964 Nov;12:55-8.
Lightbown JW, Kogut M, Mussett MV: [International formula for oleandomycin]. Bol Oficina Sanit Panam. 1967 Feb;62(2):157-65.
SOLIGNAC H: [A new antibiotic: oleandomycin]. Sem Med Prof Med Soc. 1958 Nov 20;34(40):1168-70.
CITTERIO C, CORIANDOLI EM: [Rectal absorption of oleandomycin]. Boll Soc Ital Biol Sper. 1959 Aug 31;35:976-7.
DE MORAES F, PATTO O: [Oleandomycin and bone infections]. Acta Orthop Belg. 1959 Sep-Oct;25:635-56.
Ross S: Erythromycin, oleandomycin and triacetyloleandomycin. Pediatr Clin North Am. 1968 Feb;15(1):119-29.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as aminoglycosides. These are molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.

drug-interaction.name: Eliglustat
drug-interaction.description: The metabolism of Eliglustat can be decreased when combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.description: The metabolism of Ibrutinib can be decreased when combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.description: The metabolism of Prucalopride can be decreased when combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.name: Digoxin
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Digoxin can be increased when it is combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.name: Lactulose
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Lactulose can be decreased when used in combination with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.name: Entrectinib
drug-interaction.description: The metabolism of Entrectinib can be decreased when combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.name: Triamcinolone
drug-interaction.description: Oleandomycin may decrease the excretion rate of Triamcinolone which could result in a higher serum level.

drug-interaction.name: Voxelotor
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Voxelotor can be increased when it is combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Levamlodipine can be increased when it is combined with Oleandomycin.

drug-interaction.name: Midazolam
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Midazolam can be increased when it is combined with Oleandomycin.

article.citation: Kuper JI, D'Aprile M: Drug-Drug interactions of clinical significance in the treatment of patients with Mycobacterium avium complex disease. Clin Pharmacokinet. 2000 Sep;39(3):203-14. doi: 10.2165/00003088-200039030-00003.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 3A4
polypeptide.specific-function: Cytochromes P450 are a group of heme-thiolate monooxygenases. In liver microsomes, this enzyme is involved in an NADPH-dependent electron transport pathway. It performs a variety of oxidation reactions (e.g. caffeine 8-oxidation, omeprazole sulphoxidation, midazolam 1'-hydroxylation and midazolam 4-hydroxylation) of structurally unrelated compounds, including steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics. Acts as a 1,8-cineole 2-exo-monooxygenase. The enzyme also hydroxylates etoposide (PubMed:11159812). Catalyzes 4-beta-hydroxylation of cholesterol. May catalyze 25-hydroxylation of cholesterol in vitro (PubMed:21576599).
